title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Monzie Castle, pronounced Monee (Campbell, Esq.), is three miles north from Crieff", on the road to Amulree.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: At its narroAvest point the gorge opens out in a Avoody theatre; onthe right the Braan comes braAvling down from the uplands of Amulree,and opposite its mouth, in the Avarm, sleeping holloAv of the hills, standsthe grey cathedral of Dunkeld.
